intro: Homalocalyx polyandrus, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, white, fragrant flowers that open at night. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Its botanical features make it a striking example of nocturnal flowering in the plant kingdom. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and unique blooming habit.
